benchmark_details.name: CEB (Compositional Evaluation Benchmark)
benchmark_details.overview: CEB is a Compositional Evaluation Benchmark that evaluates biases in large language models (LLMs) across different social groups and tasks, aiming to provide a comprehensive assessment of fairness and bias.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of CEB is to assess biases in large language models from various perspectives through a comprehensive suite of datasets.

data.source: Curated datasets designed for bias evaluation of LLMs covering different social groups (age, gender, race, religion) and various tasks.
data.format: Various formats including text and tabular forms as specified in tasks.
data.annotation: Datasets are constructed from existing datasets with additional samples generated using large language models.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the classification results of bias evaluation across different social groups and bias types.
methodology.interpretation: Scores indicate the level of bias, with lower scores indicating better performance (less bias).
methodology.validation: Extensive experiments were conducted to validate the performance of LLMs across various tasks.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Four social groups analyzed: age, gender, race, religion.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Licensed under the CC License to ensure open-source accessibility.
